CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1941, pg. 4 reads: "The Kay Boys' club has just completed two busy weeks of activity, during which time holiday parties and special exhibits were features of a well-rounded program. Above are scenes from some of the programs held during Christmas week.  Left to right:...Center is the Optimist club, in background, and some of the boys who enjoyed themselves at a party given by the organization... - Photos by Harris"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eight Optimist Club members, standing with nine boys behind table with toy beds and Santa Claus patterned tablecloth, in Kay Boys Club
